content.title: REMOTE WORKING POLICY
sections: 1. SCOPE: This policy covers employees working remotely (from home or other locations) on a regular or occasional basis.

2. ELIGIBILITY:

[OPTION 1: All employees may request remote working under the Flexible Working Regulations.]
[OPTION 2: Remote working available for [ELIGIBLE_ROLES] subject to approval.]

Factors considered:
- Role suitability
- Performance and reliability
- Team/customer impact
- Technology requirements

3. APPROVAL PROCESS:

- Submit request to line manager
- Manager assesses suitability
- HR approval for regular remote working
- Trial period: [TRIAL_PERIOD] months
- Review and confirm or revoke

Flexible working requests handled under Flexible Working Policy (statutory right from day 1 as of April 2024).

4. WORKING ARRANGEMENTS:

**Working pattern:** [PATTERN - e.g., 3 days office, 2 days remote]
**Core hours:** [CORE_HOURS if applicable]
**Availability:** Available during normal working hours ([HOURS])
**Location:** [Primary location - e.g., UK only. Notify if changing location.]
**Overseas working:** Requires approval due to tax, immigration, insurance implications.

5. EQUIPMENT AND TECHNOLOGY:

**Provided by Company:**
- Laptop/computer
- [Mobile phone]
- [Monitor, keyboard, mouse]
- Software licenses

**Your responsibility:**
- Broadband/internet connection (minimum [SPEED])
- Suitable workspace
- Home insurance (notify insurer of business use)

**IT Support:** [HELPDESK_CONTACT] - [HOURS]

6. HEALTH AND SAFETY:

**Company responsibilities:**
- Risk assessment of home workspace (self-assessment form)
- DSE assessment
- Provide ergonomic equipment if needed
- Employer's liability insurance covers home working

**Employee responsibilities:**
- Suitable, safe workspace (desk, chair, lighting, ventilation)
- Free from hazards
- Complete DSE self-assessment annually
- Report accidents/incidents
- Take breaks and move regularly
- Comply with Working Time Regulations (max 48-hour week, rest breaks)

7. DATA PROTECTION AND SECURITY:

- Use Company devices only (not personal computers for work)
- Encrypt sensitive data
- Use VPN for remote access
- Secure home network (strong Wi-Fi password)
- Lock screen when away from desk
- Do not work in public spaces with confidential data
- Shred or securely dispose of confidential documents
- Report lost/stolen equipment immediately
- Comply with Data Protection Policy and Acceptable Use Policy
- Do not allow family members to access Company data

GDPR compliance: Appropriate technical and organizational measures at home.

8. CONFIDENTIALITY:

- Ensure privacy during calls/video meetings (no family members overhearing)
- Secure physical documents
- No discussions of confidential matters in public or where overheard

9. COMMUNICATION AND COLLABORATION:

- Attend team meetings (in-person or virtual as required)
- Respond to emails/messages promptly during working hours
- Use [COMMUNICATION_TOOLS - e.g., Teams, Slack, Zoom]
- Maintain regular contact with manager and team
- Office attendance: [FREQUENCY - e.g., 1 day per week, monthly team meetings]

10. PERFORMANCE AND PRODUCTIVITY:

- Maintain same performance standards as office-based
- Meet deadlines and objectives
- Regular 1:1s with manager
- Performance measured by outputs, not hours worked

11. EXPENSES:

**Reimbursable:**
- [Broadband costs: £[AMOUNT] per month if Company requires upgrade]
- [Electricity: £[AMOUNT] per month]
- [Business calls/mobile]

**Not reimbursable:**
- Home insurance increase
- Rent/mortgage
- General utilities

**Tax relief:** You may claim tax relief from HMRC for home working costs (£6/week without evidence in 2025).

12. WORKING TIME:

- Record hours worked
- Take required breaks (20 mins if working 6+ hours)
- Do not work excessive hours
- Right to disconnect: No expectation to work outside agreed hours

13. INSURANCE:

- Employer's liability insurance covers home working
- Notify your home insurer you work from home (may affect policy)
- Company equipment covered by Company insurance

14. TAX AND EXPENSES:

- Tax relief for home working costs: [DETAILS]
- Company may pay [£X] per month tax-free under homeworking allowance

15. ENDING REMOTE WORKING:

We may withdraw remote working:
- Poor performance
- Security breach
- Business needs change
- Trial unsuccessful

[NOTICE_PERIOD] notice given (unless gross misconduct).

16. RESPONSIBILITIES SUMMARY:

**Manager:**
- Approve remote working requests fairly
- Maintain regular contact
- Assess performance objectively
- Support wellbeing

**Employee:**
- Maintain productivity and communication
- Comply with security policies
- Ensure safe workspace
- Be available during working hours

**IT:**
- Provide equipment and support
- Ensure secure remote access

**HR:**
- Oversee policy compliance
- Support managers and employees
content.flexible_working_2024:
From April 2024:
- Day-1 right to request flexible working (no 26-week qualifying period)
- Employers must respond within 2 months
- Can make 2 requests per year (up from 1)
- No requirement to explain impact on employer
